block.p: Jacqueline Brooke Golaine, a daughter of Rosalyn Golaine of Demarest, N.J., and Joseph Golaine of Bellaire, Tex., was married last evening to Dr. Robert Armand Florio, a son of Dolores Florio of Scarsdale, N.Y., and the late Armando Florio. Rabbi Roger Ross officiated at the Castle at Tarrytown, N.Y., with the Rev. Neil O'Connell, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Florio, 32, is sales agent at Bellmarc Realty in Manhattan. She graduated from Fairleigh Dickinson University. Her father designs and constructs closets and shelving in Bellaire. Her mother owns Abeth Realty and Schwartz Brothers Realty, both in Tenafly.

Jacqueline Brooke Golaine, a daughter of Rosalyn Golaine of Demarest, N.J., and Joseph Golaine of Bellaire, Tex., was married last evening to Dr. Robert Armand Florio, a son of Dolores Florio of Scarsdale, N.Y., and the late Armando Florio. Rabbi Roger Ross officiated at the Castle at Tarrytown, N.Y., with the Rev. Neil O'Connell, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Florio, 32, is sales agent at Bellmarc Realty in Manhattan. She graduated from Fairleigh Dickinson University. Her father designs and constructs closets and shelving in Bellaire. Her mother owns Abeth Realty and Schwartz Brothers Realty, both in Tenafly.

Dr. Florio, 39, is a resident in physical medicine and rehabilitation at the Weill Cornell Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital in Manhattan. He graduated from the State University at Stony Brook, N.Y., and received a medical degree from Howard University. His mother teaches business communications and keyboarding at Bronx Community College. His father taught earth science at Columbus High School in the Bronx.
The couple met in 1999 while working out on adjacent elliptical trainers at a gym on the Upper East Side.
